Itineraries

Tegel

Arrival

00:00

Departure

18:00

Tegel is a charming, leafy district of Berlin. Stroll around Lake Tegel, lined with charming cafés and green lanes. Tegel Castle, steeped in history, is a must-see. For aviation enthusiasts, the Tegel Museum traces the fascinating development of this sector. The Tegel Forest, the lungs of the city, invites you to enjoy invigorating hikes. Enjoy Berlin specialities in the local bistros. In the evening, a boat trip on the lake offers a unique perspective on this district combining nature and culture.

Nedlitz

Arrival

00:00

Departure

17:00

Nedlitz, a small village in Germany, is a haven of peace and tranquility. Located near Potsdam, Nedlitz is surrounded by lakes and forests, providing an ideal setting for outdoor activities such as hiking and cycling. The village is known for its nature park and Japanese garden, creating a peaceful and picturesque atmosphere.

Wuesterwitz

Arrival

00:00

Departure

23:00

Wuesterwitz, a charming village in Germany, is the perfect place for a peaceful getaway. Stroll through its quiet lanes, lined with traditional houses. Explore the surrounding green countryside, ideal for hiking and cycling. The village offers an authentic experience of the German countryside, far from the hustle and bustle of the big cities.

Wuesterwitz

Magdeburg

Arrival

00:00

Departure

14:00

Magdeburg, a German city rich in history, is famous for its Gothic cathedral, one of the largest in Europe. This city on the banks of the Elbe harmoniously blends the ancient and the modern, with lush green parks and historic buildings. Discover the science and culture park on Rotehorn Island, and don't miss the fascinating Grüne Zitadelle building, designed by architect Hundertwasser.

Magdeburg

Arrival

20:00

Departure

00:00

Magdeburg, a German city rich in history, is famous for its Gothic cathedral, one of the largest in Europe. This city on the banks of the Elbe harmoniously blends the ancient and the modern, with lush green parks and historic buildings. Discover the science and culture park on Rotehorn Island, and don't miss the fascinating Grüne Zitadelle building, designed by architect Hundertwasser.

Wittenberg

Arrival

00:00

Departure

09:00

Wittenberg, Germany's historic city, is famous for its connection with Martin Luther and the Reformation. Visit the castle church where Luther posted his 95 theses, a landmark event in European history. Luther's house, now a museum, offers a fascinating insight into his life and work. Stroll through the picturesque streets and admire the Renaissance architecture. Local specialties, such as German pastries, can be enjoyed in the charming cafés.

Wittenberg

Arrival

12:30

Departure

00:00

Wittenberg, Germany's historic city, is famous for its connection with Martin Luther and the Reformation. Visit the castle church where Luther posted his 95 theses, a landmark event in European history. Luther's house, now a museum, offers a fascinating insight into his life and work. Stroll through the picturesque streets and admire the Renaissance architecture. Local specialties, such as German pastries, can be enjoyed in the charming cafés.

Meissen

Arrival

00:00

Departure

07:00

Meissen, Germany, is world-famous for its fine porcelain, with the Meissen manufactory well worth a visit. This charming town on the banks of the River Elbe boasts a rich historical heritage. Discover the magnificent Albrechtsburg castle and Gothic cathedral, perched on a hill with panoramic views. Stroll through the cobbled streets of the old town, admiring the medieval buildings. Local wine tasting is a must, as the region is part of the Saxony Valley.

Meissen

Arrival

09:00

Departure

Dresden

Arrival

00:00

Departure

12:30

Dresden, nicknamed Germany's "Florence of the Elbe", is an architectural masterpiece. Visit the restored Frauenkirche, admire the opulence of the Zwinger Palace and browse the galleries of the Green Vault. Along the banks of the Elbe, the city offers picturesque views and green spaces inviting you to relax. Dresden harmoniously combines art, history and nature.

Dresden

Arrival

07:00

Departure

00:00

Dresden, nicknamed Germany's "Florence of the Elbe", is an architectural masterpiece. Visit the restored Frauenkirche, admire the opulence of the Zwinger Palace and browse the galleries of the Green Vault. Along the banks of the Elbe, the city offers picturesque views and green spaces inviting you to relax. Dresden harmoniously combines art, history and nature.

Loschwitz

Arrival

00:00

Departure

08:00

Loschwitz, a picturesque district of Dresden, Germany, is famous for its historic charm and panoramic views of the Elbe Valley. Visit the famous Loschwitz funicular and suspension bridge, offering unique perspectives on the region. Streets lined with old villas and manicured gardens bear witness to Loschwitz's elegance. Art galleries and inviting cafés add to its serene atmosphere. It's a perfect destination for those looking to explore a peaceful and cultural side of Dresden.

Wehlen

Arrival

00:00

Departure

12:00

Wehlen, a charming German village on the banks of the Moselle, is famous for its vineyards and picturesque landscape. Visitors can taste Moselle wines, renowned for their finesse, and stroll through the terraced vineyards. The village offers a peaceful atmosphere, with traditional houses and a beautiful view of the river. Wehlen is a pleasant stopover for wine lovers and lovers of bucolic landscapes.

Usti Nad Labem

Arrival

00:00

Departure

23:00

Usti Nad Labem, a historic town in the Czech Republic, offers a blend of culture and nature. Explore Strekov Castle, perched on a rocky outcrop, for a breathtaking view of the Elbe River. Art lovers will appreciate the city's art museum. Stroll through the green parks and along the river. Enjoy the local cuisine, with its traditional Czech dishes. Usti Nad Labem is an ideal base for exploring the mountains of North Bohemia.

Roudnice

Arrival

00:00

Departure

12:00

Roudnice in the Czech Republic is a small, historic town known for its Roudnice Castle and ancient bridge over the Elbe River. The town has a rich history, with beautiful buildings and churches to explore. Roudnice is also a starting point for visiting the vineyards of the Bohemia region, offering tastings of local wines.

Kralupy Nad Vltavou

Arrival

00:00

Departure

20:30

Kralupy Nad Vltavou, a town in the Czech Republic, is nestled along the Vltava River. Explore the hiking trails along the river for picturesque views. The town is known for its rich industrial history and refineries. Visit local churches and discover traditional architecture. Its proximity to Prague makes it an ideal base for exploring the Czech capital.

Its proximity to Prague makes it an ideal base for exploring the Czech capital.

Rostoky

Arrival

00:00

Departure

08:00

Roztoky, near Prague in the Czech Republic, is a picturesque little town offering a blend of nature and history. Visit Roztoky Castle, an important cultural monument, and explore its art and history exhibitions. The town is also ideal for hiking and strolling along the Vltava River.

Prague

Arrival

00:00

Departure

12:30

The port:

Prague's river port on the Vltava is a key element in accessing this historic city. Although Prague is not directly on the coast, its river port, some 4 kilometers from the city center, offers a picturesque entrance to the Czech capital. Visitors can easily reach the heart of Prague by public transport or cab.

What to see in Prague

Prague, known for its exceptional architecture and rich history, offers a myriad of attractions. The Old Town, with its astronomical clock and cobbled streets, is a must-see. Prague Castle, dominating the city, is a vast complex that includes St. Vitus Cathedral. The Charles Bridge, adorned with statues, is one of Prague's most emblematic symbols. For art and culture lovers, the Mala Strana district abounds with galleries, cafés and picturesque gardens.

What to visit in the surrounding area

Prague's surroundings also offer plenty to discover. Kutná Hora, with its unique ossuary church and historical heritage, is a popular excursion. Karlštejn Castle, an imposing Gothic fortress, is a fascinating journey through medieval Czech history. For a natural experience, the Central Bohemia region offers magnificent scenery and hiking opportunities.
